name: Aerodactyl

abilities.name: Prehistoric Power
abilities.text: No more Evolution cards can be played. This power stops working while Aerodactyl is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

flavorText: A ferocious prehistoric Pok√©mon that goes for the enemy's throat with its serrated saw-like fangs.

strengths: Prehistoric Power completely shuts down evolution decks
Colorless attack cost allows flexibility in deck building
Fighting resistance is useful against Haymaker decks
Can be played quickly via Mysterious Fossil
Non-holo version is more affordable and accessible
weaknesses: Only 60 HP is fragile for a key strategic piece
Wing Attack is underwhelming at 30 damage for 3 energy
Shuts down your own evolutions as well
counters: Gust of Wind to force Aerodactyl active and KO it
Energy Removal to slow down setup

competitiveHistory: This non-holo version of Aerodactyl is functionally identical to the holo version (#1). The Prehistoric Power ability was format-defining, creating the 'Aerodactyl Lock' archetype that prevented opponents from evolving. This made it essential for Haymaker and other Basic Pokemon strategies. The non-holo printing made it more accessible for competitive players.

rulings.ruling: Prehistoric Power affects both players - neither player can play Evolution cards while Aerodactyl's power is active.
If Aerodactyl becomes Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed, Evolution cards can be played until it recovers.
Mysterious Fossil counts as a Basic Pokemon for evolution purposes, allowing Aerodactyl to be played as a Stage 1.
Pokemon Breeder cannot bypass Prehistoric Power - no evolution cards of any kind can be played.
